Text:
Nearly all of Gamma's duties consist of her work
related to Mitsugoshi.

Regardless of her feelings on the matter, she has no
choice given her poor combat ability.

Though her one true desire is to fight in style
alongside her lord, she keeps it a secret.

And so, today Gamma once again finds herself hard at
work dealing with her business.

She is currently in Madlid, a remote corner of the
Velgalta Empire.

Discussions are underway with a lord to open a new
store in his domain.
Lady Luna, we highly recommend this property.

In charge of guiding Gamma's tour is Rude,
the lord's eldest son.

Luna is Gamma's alter ego, the name she uses as
the director of Mitsugoshi.

It's situated facing the main avenue, offers wide
frontage, and is very sunny. Our asking price,
including the plot, is 140 million zeni, but for
you we will accept just 120 million.

We would be delighted to be home to the second branch
of Mitsugoshi here in Velgalta!

This is all very nice. However, there is the matter
of our redevelopment after the disaster in the Sacred
Land...

But this fabulous property could be yours for a
mere 120 million zeni!

Yes. And yet, despite such a low asking price, this
wonderful property remains unsold...

The location is admittedly superb, and the building
itself is not bad either. Though slightly old, it spans
three floors, has a spacious layout, and is sturdy.

It could serve well as a store with some remodeling,
but there is also the option of tearing it down and
building anew.

The only issue is that all they want for this property,
despite its prime location, is a mere 120 million.

In the capital of Midgar, a location like this would
go for nearly ten times that, and one could assume
five times that in a rural city of similar scale.

If a property is being offered for that cheap,
it goes without saying there is a reason.

Put bluntly, due to its remote location, Madlid is
suffering from population decline. Among the
various reasons, two are rather prominent.
First, the city itself is poorly located.

It takes more than a month for a fully-loaded carriage
to reach the next closest town.

In terms of time and expense, this is obviously not a
suitable place to do business.

Second, the capital of Velgalta is thriving, and this
draws all the young people and merchants there.

The opening of Mitsugoshi's Velgalta branch and the
accompanying redevelopment does play a part in the
capital's prosperity, but both Gamma and Rude avoid
making mention of that.

Thus, for the aforementioned reasons, the city of
Madlid does not hold any appeal.

Only large firms can afford a large building on a main
street like this. And there are similar properties nearly
everywhere.

Put simply, so long as the fundamental issues remain
unsolved, opening a new store in this city will be
tantamount to financial suicide.

B-But this is merely a temporary situation. If you
open a Mitsugoshi branch here, Madlid will roar
to life!

The young lord is desperate. He would naturally
have heard the rumors of Mitsugoshi's arrival in
the capital.

If Madlid had its own branch, it could stop the tide
of depopulation and cause their failing economy to
bounce back—or so he naively assumed.

It goes without saying that this is not how things
would work out.

If the underlying problems are not fixed, adding a
Mitsugoshi branch would be nothing more than a
drop in the bucket.

Word of Mistugoshi's expansion to the imperial
capital has spread all the way to even our humble
ears as lords of this remote province.

We have staked the future of Madlid on Mitsugoshi
coming to our fair city...!
A-And so I say...100 million zeni shall suffice!

Seeing Gamma's indecision, Rude drops his price even
lower.

I shall also add priority usage of warehouse
facilities along with various tax incentives—

But, Gamma does not have the slightest intention of
giving her answer for a measly discount of 20 million
zeni.

She has already spent more than a week viewing
properties in the area and has yet to give a definite
answer.
Gamma has already seen all that she needed to.
She is merely waiting.
Excuse me, Miss Luna.

Nu, dressed in a Mitsugoshi uniform, approaches from
behind and whispers in Gamma's ear.
We've finished the survey.
And?
It will work.
Is it here?
There is no mistake—it's petroleum.
Gamma smiles at Rude for the first time that day.
I'll take it.
Er, Umm... What?
In fact, I'll take every plot on this road.
...Come again?

I'm saying that if you find my conditions acceptable,
we will redevelop Madlid and make it the finest city
in all of Velgalta.

Nu exits the room and issuesorders to her
subordinates.

Buy up all the necessary land downstream of the Nyle
River. It begins now...
...The real estate bubble!
That reminds me, what about Delta?
She...hasn't returned yet.
Don't tell me... She's still in the Sacred Land?
Awooooooo!!!
Shall we go retrieve her?

Just leave her be. She'll come back when it starts to
get cold.
Epsilon's fingers tap away on the piano.
Alpha just happens to be passing by...
and stops when she hears the sound.
Beta writes a novel while Omega and Chi play chess.

And in the background of it all, Epsilon plays her
music.
It is a sight like any other day.
Well?
Moonlight flows into the quiet forest.
Within it stands a stout-looking structure.
Yeah...
(A familiar building style from another world...)

Two-by-four—all thanks to the architectural
techniques you taught us.
I see...

Inside the house, everyone is enjoying a bit of free
time.
Beta reads a book while Delta naps contentedly.
Epsilon and Gamma are preparing dinner.

Our temporary base is also complete. Now we can begin
their training in earnest.

First off, do you think those girls even have what it
takes?

Yes, I'm certain we will have need of them. In order
to combat the Cult, we will need to both bolster our
ranks and strengthen our individual combat prowess.
Yeah, suppose that's what the scenario calls for...

Furthermore, those girls also desire the strength to
fight the Cult.
I...see.

In that case, I shall grant them a fragment of my
wisdom...the power to carry out one's will within
the darkness.
Yes...
...Give these children strength.
For Alpha, this is a precious sight.

She gazes fondly at Beta whiling these peaceful
moments away.
Lady Alpha.
Gamma steps into view.
We've received word from the the Oriana Kingdom.

The prime minister, Duke Perv Asshat, is making his
way to Midgar.
Alpha's face takes on the aspect of a warrior.

Perv Asshat... So they're hoping to stir up more
trouble in the capital, are they...
